titles.title: Providing for consideration of the bill (S. 403) to amend title 18, United States Code, to prohibit taking minors across State lines in circumvention of laws requiring the involvement of parents in abortion decisions.

action.text: The House Committee on Rules reported an original measure, H. Rept. 109-679, by Mr. Gingrey.
The amendment in the nature of a substitute printed in the report of the Committee on Rules accompanying this resolution shall be considered as adopted.

calendar.text: Placed on the House Calendar, Calendar No. 235.

action.text: DEBATE - The House proceeded with one hour of debate on H. Res. 1039.
The previous question was ordered without objection.

POSTPONED PROCEEDINGS - At the conclusion of the debate on H. Res. 1039, the Chair put the question on adoption of the resolution and by voice vote, announced the ayes had prevailed. Mr. McGovern demanded the yeas and nays and the Chair postponed further proceedings on adoption of the resolution until later in the legislative day.

vote.text: On agreeing to the resolution Agreed to by the Yeas and Nays: 249 - 157 (Roll no. 475).

action.text: Motion to reconsider laid on the table Agreed to without objection.

bill.summary: 9/26/2006--Passed House without amendment. Sets forth the rule for consideration of H.R. 2679 (Child Custody Protection Act).
